awd_titl_txt: Instruments for Undergraduate Instruction in Snow and Ice   Climatology
awd_abstract_narration: Field instruments, including low temperature anemometers, a pyronometer         to measure net radiation loading at the ground or snow surface, a 20-           channel data logging device suitable for remote low temperature use, and        associated computing equipment are being used to improve undergraduate          instruction in the Northern Studies curriculum.  Field data concerning          snow, ice and the lower atmosphere is being recorded and analyzed.  In          laboratory and field locations, the measurement and analysis of the             micro-climatology of snow and ice is being done by students, for the            first time in a new sophomore course, and with substantially increased          scale and sophistication in the mandatory Senior Thesis program.  The           equipment is particularly well suited to the study of nearby snow and           rime-ice environments at elevations above treeline in the Green                 Mountains of Vermont (an ongoing study at Middlebury College).

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: PRESIDENT AND FELLOWS OF MIDDLEBURY COLLEGE
